messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

I just submitted my copy. Fingers crossed, it will work.

Alex

LGTM after you spell function name correctly.

FYI, you should be able to run "GOOS=windows go install -v -a std" to check that windows Go builds.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530075/diff/2002/src/pkg/net/sockoptip_windows.go
File src/pkg/net/sockoptip_windows.go (left):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530075/diff/2002/src/pkg/net/sockoptip_windows.go#oldcode33
src/pkg/net/sockoptip_windows.go:33: func ipv4MultiastLoopback(fd *netFD) (bool, error) {
s/ipv4MultiastLoopback/ipv4MulticastLoopback/

On Tue, Jan 10, 2012 at 19:36,  <alex.brainman@gmail.com> wrote:
> FYI, you should be able to run "GOOS=windows go install -v -a std" to
> check that windows Go builds.

You can also s/install/build/ and then it doesn't even keep
the results.

> FYI, you should be able to run "GOOS=windows go install -v -a std" to
> check that windows Go builds.

Thank you and sorry for the inconvenience.
I just checked Go Wiki.

<http://code.google.com/p/go-wiki/wiki/WindowsCrossCompiling>

Nice.

On Wed, Jan 11, 2012 at 12:58 PM,  <alex.brainman@gmail.com> wrote:

> I just submitted my copy. Fingers crossed, it will work.

I'll abandon this CL.

subject: code review 5530075: net: fix windows build
